result.execSummary:
The defendant Mason Lee Hutter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with Extended Supervision on 11CF10 and 04CF33.
Credit for 171 days if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to 11CF10 and 04CF33

miscConds.notes: Defendant to meet with payment clerk.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott J. Nordstand August 8, 2019 - Amend pre-sentence credit.



-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 04CF33 and 11CF10

superMiscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Concurrent with: 04CF33 and 11CF10

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Edward Minser, DF ATTY: Philip A. Helgeson, DF: Mason Lee Hutter appeared.  Court called at 3:45 p.m.  Set for SEH.  DE makes statement and his recommendation and argument for his sentence.  Attorney Helgeson and the DE request recess to discuss the case.  Recess at 3:55 p.m.  Case recalled.  DE will proceed with the sentencing today.  Crt orders:

- DE sentenced to 18 months I/C and 24 months of E/S to run consecutive with Pierce County Case 04CF33 & St. Croix County Case 11CF10
- Credit for 299 days for time served
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- 20 days to appeal

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF: Mason Lee Hutter appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:38 a.m.  Set for PTC.  Attorney Stormont has filed Motion to modify the bond.  ADA Sortedahl objects to modfication of the bond  Attorneys make arguments.  Speedy trial demand by the DE.  Attorney Stormont is asking for time to speak with his client on possible resolution.  Recess at 9:45 a.m.  Case recalled at 10:15 a.m. State files the amended Information with the Court.  ADA Sortedahl recites the agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to amended Ct 1 as a repeater Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1  repeater.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

S/W 3 years probation to run concurrent with the E/S on 11CF10 & 04CF33
- AODA with follow through and any recommended treatment
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Court costs of $268 
- DE to meet with payment clerk
- Credit for 171 days if revoked.
- 20 days to appeal
